Q: You are Mr. Morton M. Mendels, and you came to the Bank in

doc.repnme: Transcript of oral history interview with Morton M. Mendels held on July 17, 1961
doc.abstracts: In July 1961, Morton M. Mendels was interviewed on behalf of the World Bank Group Archives oral history program by Robert Oliver. During his tenure at the Bank from 1946 to 1973, Mr. Mendels worked in the following areas: as first secretary of the World Bank (1946-1973) and in the department of the secretary as an advisor for the bank and fund conferences office (1973). Before that he practiced law in Montreal and worked on the Canadian General Staff in Ottawa, managing the money of the Canadian Army. His transcript concerns his relationship with the executive directors of the World Bank, shareholders, the presidencies of John McCloy, Eugene Black, George Woods, and Robert McNamara, and the Marshall Plan.
